moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4: The King's Gambit, and Miller is an honorable person: it must be accepted!
moves.3. Bc4: In some variations of the Bishop's Gambit, White is prepared to move his King to KB1. Both sides must worry about an attack centered on KB7.
moves.3... f5: The hand is quicker than the mind. This move exposes Black to a potential Q-R5.
moves.4. exf5: White gratefully recaptures his gambited material.
moves.4... b6: Preparing to fianchetto the B. But in open games, such slow development often proves fatal.
moves.5... Ke7: Miller sees that P-N3 is futile, but this move isn't any better.
moves.6. Qf7+: The King-hunt is on in earnest.
moves.6... Kd6 7. Nc3 Ba6: Taking advantage of the momentary lull to attack the B. But the lull was just the calm in the eye of the hurricane.
